title: Great for a roadtrip
text: I gave this to my 4 year old for a roadtrip.It kept her occupied for at least 30 minutes, which is a long time for a short attention span. As long as the road isn‚Äôt too bumpy, this is a great distraction.She found it a little difficult to change out the cards, since they are a little flimsy and the slot is small, but still great overall.Big plus is that it is quiet and doesn‚Äôt have small parts that can get lost in the car.You just have to keep tabs on the magnet pen.There is a spot to store it, but it is not secured to the board with a string while in use.

name: BeachLover
title: Teacher Approved!
text: The media could not be loaded.¬†I got this as a fun, but educational tool to use in my classroom and the students are really loving it!It is great for learning colors and also patterns and numbers.It comes with many patterns to use and these also help to work on concentration.It is durable and withstands some roughness.The magnetism works as it should and the disks stay in place once put down.This was an excellent price and is a good educational toy that is lots of fun - my classroom aids even like playing with it when we don't have students!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 10, 2023
name: Darling Nikki
title: Super cute
text: The media could not be loaded.¬†I am one of those aunts who tries to buy educational toys,but they must be fun as well.This certainly fits the bill.I bought it for my 3 year old nephew,but my 7 year old niece loved it, too.It's a great way to practice their fine motor skills while they learn about colors, shapes, spatial awareness,etc.The baby needed some help at first getting the hang of the magnet pen, but he caught on quickly.He had a great time matching the colored dots to the ones on the pictures and making up designs of his own.For the 7 year old, I decided to make it a little harder.I didn't slide the guide picture in it and asked her to memorize it instead.It was difficult enough to hold her attention,but not too frustrating.It makes a good option for a travel toy because the pieces are trapped inside it and can't get lost.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 8, 2023

text: My 5 year old loves it. It‚Äôs bright color, durable, compact. Friendly for small kids. It‚Äôs super easy to figure out and fun to play. Because all the pieces are inclosed in the case, It won‚Äôt make a mess or lose any piece.She was playing it with her older brother for a couple of on the 4 hr trip to DC.However, the magnetic pen fell off from the holder and got lost in the hotel but the cleaning lady found it after we left. Thanks to the hotel that they mailed it to our home. I used a long string attached the pen to the handle on the pad so the problem solved.
